intro: Struthiola ovata, commonly known as the ovate struthiola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, legume-like pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
